Obtain set of non-overlapping exons

Source: R/optimise-ERs.R
get_exons.Rd

Obtain set of non-overlapping exons

get_exons(gtf, ucsc_chr, ignore.strand = TRUE)

Arguments

gtf

Either a string containg the path to a .gtf file or a pre-imported gtf using import.
ucsc_chr

logical scalar, determining whether to add "chr" prefix to the seqnames of non-overlapping exons and change "chrMT" -> "chrM". Note, if set to TRUE and seqnames already have "chr", it will not add another.
ignore.strand

logical value for input into findOverlaps, default is True.

Value

GRanges object containing non-overlapping exons.

Examples

gtf_url <- paste0(
    "http://ftp.ensembl.org/pub/release-103/gtf/",
    "homo_sapiens/Homo_sapiens.GRCh38.103.chr.gtf.gz"
)
gtf_path <- ODER:::.file_cache(gtf_url)
eg_exons_no_overlap <- get_exons(
    gtf = gtf_path,
    ucsc_chr = TRUE,
    ignore.strand = TRUE
)

#> [1] "2021-05-10 13:20:34 - Loading in GTF..."
#> [1] "2021-05-10 13:21:15 - Obtaining non-overlapping exons"

print(eg_exons_no_overlap)
